Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of ANG-3777 in Renal Transplantation

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomized 2:1 to receive ANG-3777 (2 mg/kg, n=19) or placebo (n=9)

Participants.evidence: patients with <50 cc/h urine output for 8 consecutive hours or creatinine reduction ratio <30% within 24 hours posttransplantation. The study was conducted at five US sites.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomized 2:1 to receive ANG-3777 (2 mg/kg, n=19) or placebo (n=9) via three once-daily IV infusions.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was time to achieve ≥1200 cc urine output over 24 hours within 28 days.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Participants were randomized 2:1 to receive ANG-3777 (2 mg/kg, n=19) or placebo (n=9)

Result_Outcome.evidence: By day 28, 83.3% of ANG-3777 patients achieved the primary outcome versus 50% in placebo (log-rank test: χ²=2.799, P=0.09).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events occurred in a similar percentage of subjects in both arms, but events per subject were twice as high in the placebo arm.
